column4: I've been working now for 4 days trying to get my video to go back to 'better'.. my current xorg.conf is here http://pastebin.com/m3e5a40df I cannot get full screen video, period. if I try, all I get is a flash of the full screen video and it returns to windowed mode (this is all on streaming video), when I try to watch a .flv locally from the desktop it is very lagged and choppy. Again, 4 days and I haven't even managed to move 1 inch
in the right direction, could someone help me out with this? ATI fglrx drivers + Ubuntu Hardy
whats the output of lspci | grep VGA
01:05.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc RS690M [Radeon X1200 Series]
gaint sura: urs is 32 bit or 64 bit?
I'm running on 32 bit, but 64 bit capable
I'd like to point out that I've been in here 4 days running now trying to get help, when I enable the ATI driver (from the driver manager applet) I lose all GUI
hold on for some time.. im searching..
i hav to leave now.. try reposting it.. all i can say is install driver from http://ati.amd.com/support/driver.html ,, sorry i hav to leave now.. hope others solve ur prob :) bye
